components.description:
A metal bolt with a nut threaded around it, as by a wrench. Often positioned at a 45° angle, the head of the bolt at the upper left. Commonly used for various content concerning tools, building, and construction. May also be used for other hardware, including screws.

Apple’s bolt previously resembled a screw, Google’s a dumbbell; Microsoft’s design previously featured the nut and bolt separately.
components.title: Nut and Bolt

title: Nut and Bolt

version.description:
Released in October 2010, Unicode 6.0 was the first version of the Unicode Standard to support emoji.

Some characters in prior versions of Unicode were retroactively updated to provide an emoji presentation. This release was the first to introduce new characters for the sole purpose of compatability with emojis being used in Japan.

emoji_net_data.category: Miscellaneous Symbols And Pictographs -> Tool symbols

emoji_net_data.name: nut and bolt

bn:00084308v: To bring back to a previous condition or state.
To restore to good working order, fix, or improve damaged condition; to mend; to remedy.
To reinstate an item that was deleted.
Restore by replacing a part or putting together what is torn or broken
To change the state of an item (e.g. which was torn or broken) to a working condition again.

bn:00058343n: Device that can be screwed on a bolt.
Type of fastener with a threaded hole
A small (usually square or hexagonal) metal block with internal screw thread to be fitted onto a bolt
A nut is a type of fastener with a threaded hole.
A metal object used for fastening
A fastener: a piece of metal, usually square or hexagonal in shape, with a hole through it having machined internal threads, intended to be screwed onto a bolt or other threaded shaft.
